subject: Career
title: Political Capital in Organizations
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Political Capital in Organizations.

hook.text: Two equally talented people. One gets promoted. Why? She had more political capital ‚Äî people wanted her to succeed.

buildup.text: Political capital is the influence you accumulate through trust, alliances, and demonstrated value.

discovery.text: It's spent when you ask for resources, push controversial ideas, or seek promotion.

twist.text: Spending all your capital at once ‚Äî like pushing too many changes ‚Äî leaves you powerless when it counts.

climax.text: Build capital steadily: deliver wins, help peers, build alliances. Spend it strategically.

punchline.text: Talent gets noticed. Political capital gets promoted.

quiz.question: What is political capital in an organization?
options: Influence accumulated through trust, alliances, and demonstrated value
